function.name: raDecLatLonGMST2azAlt
function.desc: Given the right ascension and declination of a celestial object, the latitude and longitude of an observer, and the Greenwich mean sidereal time, return the objects azimuth and altitude. All angles and times must be given in radians
function.body: List[ArcTan[Plus[Times[Cos[lat], Sin[dec]], Times[-1, Cos[dec], Cos[Plus[gmst, lon, Times[-1, ra]]], Sin[lat]]], Times[-1, Cos[dec], Sin[Plus[gmst, lon, Times[-1, ra]]]]], ArcTan[Power[Plus[Power[Plus[Times[Cos[lat], Sin[dec]], Times[-1, Cos[dec], Cos[Plus[gmst, lon, Times[-1, ra]]], Sin[lat]]], 2], Times[Power[Cos[dec], 2], Power[Sin[Plus[gmst, lon, Times[-1, ra]]], 2]]], Rational[1, 2]], Plus[Times[Cos[dec], Cos[lat], Cos[Plus[gmst, lon, Times[-1, ra]]]], Times[Sin[dec], Sin[lat]]]]]

function.name: raDecLatLonAlt2GMST
function.desc: Given an object's right ascension and declination, an observer's latitude and longitude, and a target altitude alt, return the two daily sidereal times (in radians) at which the object will have altitude alt
function.body: List[Plus[Times[-1, lon], ra, ArcCos[Plus[Times[Sec[dec], Sec[lat], Sin[alt]], Times[-1, Tan[dec], Tan[lat]]]]], Plus[Times[-1, lon], ra, Times[-1, ArcCos[Plus[Times[Sec[dec], Sec[lat], Sin[alt], Times[-1, Tan[dec], Tan[lat]]]]]]]]

function.name: decLatAlt2TimeAboveAlt
function.desc: Given an object's declination, a viewer's latitude, and a target altitude, return the amount of time (in sidereal radians) that the object is above the given altitude per sidereal day
function.body: Times[2, ArcCos[Plus[Times[Sec[dec], Sec[lat], Sin[alt]], Times[-1, Tan[dec], Tan[lat]]]]]

function.name: decLatAlt2az
function.desc: Given an object's declination, an observer's latitude, and a target altitude alt, return the two azimuths at which the object has altitude alt; these values will be positive/negative of each other
function.body: List[ArcCos[Plus[Times[Sec[alt], Sec[lat], Sin[dec]], Times[-1, Tan[alt], Tan[lat]]]], Times[-1, ArcCos[Plus[Times[Sec[alt], Sec[lat], Sin[dec]], Times[-1, Tan[alt], Tan[lat]]]]]]

function.name: decLatAlt2azAbs
function.desc: Given an object's declination, a viewer's latitude, and a target altitudealt, return the absolute value of the azimuth position when the object's altitude is alt; the actual azimuth is plus or minus this value
function.body: Abs[ArcCos[Plus[Times[Sec[alt], Sec[lat], Sin[dec]], Times[-1, Tan[alt], Tan[lat]]]]]

function.name: vectorAngle
function.desc: The angular distance between spherical coordinates {thone, ph_one} and {thtwo, ph_two}, all in radians
function.body: ArcCos[Plus[Times[Cos[ph_one], Cos[ph_two], Cos[Plus[thone, Times[-1, thtwo]]]], Times[Sin[ph_one], Sin[ph_two]]]]
